sections.text:
This feature adds a dedicated “Sync status” panel on the Issue page whenever a Jira or Linear issue is linked. Instead of treating the integration as a passive link-out, the panel makes the relationship explicit by showing the external issue key with a direct link, plus a clear state indicator (e.g., Healthy vs Error) so users can quickly understand whether updates are flowing.

To build trust in the two-way sync, the panel will also display “Last synced at” and “Last external update at” timestamps. This gives users concrete proof of freshness and helps them diagnose common questions like “Did my change actually push?” or “Is Jira ahead of what I’m seeing here?” without needing to leave the Issue page or ask an admin.

When sync is unhealthy, the panel will surface actionable error messaging (e.g., missing permissions, issue not found, auth expired) rather than generic failures. The goal is to reduce support burden and unblock users faster by making the cause and next step visible at the point of failure.

Finally, we’ll add self-serve controls for manual recovery: “Refresh from Jira/Linear” and “Push update.” These actions will call existing sync endpoints to re-run the sync on demand, reducing escalation and improving confidence that users can resolve transient issues or force an update when timing matters.
